occurrences.text: tree in the water and the waters were healed and now they could drink the waters. What a blessing to see how God blessed and worked and provided. And then in just a little while God leads them again and now they come to a place where there's no water. You say God don't you know that we need water? Yeah He knows. He's aware. I think it's interesting I actually said this to the young people. God could have led them again to a place that had bitter water. What would you have done? What do you think they would have done if God took them to a place again that had bitter water? I think they would have looked for a tree. They would have looked for a tree that resembled the tree that they put in the previous waters. Why? Because that's human nature. We just like to depend upon ourselves. Right? So what does God do? He takes them to a place where there's no water. And then He supplies water from a rock. These people had experienced the power of God displayed over and over and over. And in Numbers 13, they bring up this evil report. In Numbers 14, there's this great discourse that takes place. And of course, Joshua and Caleb are trying to steal the people and get them to believe God and to enter into. And Caleb says this. And in verse 7 it says, and they spake in Numbers 14,
